Latest News
===========

[![Image 2: A building burns in Sweida City in western Syria, as hostilities broke out during July 2025.](https://global.unitednations.entermediadb.net/assets/mediadb/services/module/asset/downloads/preset/Collections/Embargoed/24-07-2025-UNOCHA-Syria-Sweida-03.jpg/image350x235cropped.jpg)](https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165620)

 © UNOCHA/Ali Haj Suleiman 

[Security Council voices deep concern over deadly escalation in Syria’s Sweida region](https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165620)
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

10 August 2025

[Peace and Security](https://news.un.org/en/news/topic/peace-and-security)

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165620 "Share this via Facebook (opens in a new window)")[Twitter](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Security%20Council%20voices%20deep%20concern%20over%20deadly%20escalation%20in%20Syria%E2%80%99s%20Sweida%20region&url=https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165620 "Share this via Twitter (opens in a new window)")

The [UN Security Council](https://main.un.org/securitycouncil/en) has expressed alarm at the sharp escalation of violence in Syria’s Sweida region since mid-July, condemning attacks against civilians and calling for urgent protection and humanitarian access.

[![Image 5: A young girl in Gaza rests her hand on her head, an empty pot held close as starvation now stalks the enclave.](https://global.unitednations.entermediadb.net/assets/mediadb/services/module/asset/downloads/preset/Libraries/Production%20Library/21-07-2025_UNNews_Gaza_Starvation_Girl.jpg/image350x235cropped.jpg)](https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165619)

 UN News 

[‘There is no military solution’ to end Israel-Palestine conflict, Security Council hears, as starvation stalks the Gaza Strip](https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165619)
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

10 August 2025

[Peace and Security](https://news.un.org/en/news/topic/peace-and-security)

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165619 "Share this via Facebook (opens in a new window)")[Twitter](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=%E2%80%98There%20is%20no%20military%20solution%E2%80%99%20to%20end%20Israel-Palestine%20conflict,%20Security%20Council%20hears,%20as%20starvation%20stalks%20the%20Gaza%20Strip&url=https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165619 "Share this via Twitter (opens in a new window)")

It’s essential to work towards a two-State solution to the Israel-Palestine conflict as the international community addresses the reality of starvation on the ground in Gaza, the Security Council heard on Sunday.

[![Image 6: Members of a farming association in Jérémie plant black beans.](https://global.unitednations.entermediadb.net/assets/mediadb/services/module/asset/downloads/preset/Collections/Embargoed/11-11-2021-Haiti-FAO4.jpg/image350x235cropped.jpg)](https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165600)

 UN Haiti/Daniel Dickinson 

[From crisis to cultivation: Haiti’s farmers build resilience one seed at a time](https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165600)
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

10 August 2025

[Economic Development](https://news.un.org/en/news/topic/economic-development)

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165600 "Share this via Facebook (opens in a new window)")[Twitter](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=From%20crisis%20to%20cultivation:%20Haiti%E2%80%99s%20farmers%20build%20resilience%20one%20seed%20at%20a%20time%20%20&url=https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165600 "Share this via Twitter (opens in a new window)")

For years, low-quality seeds have been a concern in Haiti, with continual climate shocks and political insecurity adding to the existing challenges that farmers face in their attempts to grow food.

[![Image 7: The Security Council met following the Israeli cabinet’s decision to again expand its military operation inside the Gaza Strip and take full control of the key population centre of Gaza City. ](https://global.unitednations.entermediadb.net/assets/mediadb/services/module/asset/downloads/preset/Libraries/Production%20Library/10-08-25-security-council-wide.jpg/image350x235cropped.jpg)](https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165616)

 UN Photo/Evan Schneider 

[SECURITY COUNCIL LIVE: Ambassadors meet in emergency session, amid starvation in the Gaza Strip](https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165616)
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

10 August 2025

[Peace and Security](https://news.un.org/en/news/topic/peace-and-security)

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165616 "Share this via Facebook (opens in a new window)")[Twitter](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=SECURITY%20COUNCIL%20LIVE:%20Ambassadors%20meet%20in%20emergency%20session,%20amid%20starvation%20in%20the%20Gaza%20Strip&url=https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165616 "Share this via Twitter (opens in a new window)")

The [UN Security Council](https://main.un.org/securitycouncil/en) met Sunday morning in New York following the Israeli cabinet’s decision to again expand its military operation inside the Gaza Strip and take full control of the key population centre of Gaza City. UN chief António Guterres described it earlier as a “dangerous escalation” for the two million civilians trapped in the enclave as well as the remaining Israeli hostages still held captive. Follow our [Meetings Coverage](https://press.un.org/en/live) Section’s live reporting of the crisis meeting and UN News app users can [follow here](https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165616).

[![Image 8: A Gazan woman holds precious food items she has managed to receive from an aid truck.](https://global.unitednations.entermediadb.net/assets/mediadb/services/module/asset/downloads/preset/Libraries/Production%20Library/04-08-2025-UN-News-Gazans-Mother.jpg/image350x235cropped.jpg)](https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165618)

 UN News 

[Aid blockade deepens Gaza crisis as malnutrition deaths rise, warns UNRWA](https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165618)
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

9 August 2025

[Peace and Security](https://news.un.org/en/news/topic/peace-and-security)

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165618 "Share this via Facebook (opens in a new window)")[Twitter](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Aid%20blockade%20deepens%20Gaza%20crisis%20as%20malnutrition%20deaths%20rise,%20warns%20UNRWA&url=https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165618 "Share this via Twitter (opens in a new window)")

The UN agency for Palestine refugees (UNRWA)[has warned that](https://www.unrwa.org/resources/reports/unrwa-situation-report-183-situation-gaza-strip-and-west-bank-including-east-jerusalem "(opens in a new window)") the Gaza Strip faces a “catastrophic” humanitarian crisis, with no agency aid allowed in for more than five months and malnutrition deaths climbing sharply.

[![Image 9: Anima Akhter, 24, proudly introduces her seven-month-old son to UNFPA Representative Catherine Breen Kamkong during a community visit to Bodipur village. ](https://global.unitednations.entermediadb.net/assets/mediadb/services/module/asset/downloads/preset/Libraries/Production%20Library/30-07-25_UNFPA_Bangladesh-2.jpeg/image350x235cropped.jpg)](https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165615)

 © UNFPA Bangladesh 

[Preparing for the next flood: Protecting women’s health in Bangladesh](https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165615)
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

9 August 2025

[Climate and Environment](https://news.un.org/en/news/topic/climate-change)

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165615 "Share this via Facebook (opens in a new window)")[Twitter](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Preparing%20for%20the%20next%20flood:%20Protecting%20women%E2%80%99s%20health%20in%20Bangladesh%20&url=https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165615 "Share this via Twitter (opens in a new window)")

Climate change has worsened monsoon flooding in Bangladesh, putting women of child-bearing age at risk – but the UN reproductive health agency (UNFPA) is helping them prepare.

[![Image 10: A cutting operator works in a garment factory in Lesotho, a landlocked nation that plays a key role in supplying regional and continental markets with textiles, apparel and other goods.](https://global.unitednations.entermediadb.net/assets/mediadb/services/module/asset/downloads/preset/Libraries/Production%20Library/23-09-2022_ILO_Lesotho.jpg/image350x235cropped.jpg)](https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165614)

 © ILO/Marcel Crozet 

[Africa’s ‘land-linked’ economies poised to drive continent’s prosperity](https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165614)
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

8 August 2025

[Economic Development](https://news.un.org/en/news/topic/economic-development)

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165614 "Share this via Facebook (opens in a new window)")[Twitter](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Africa%E2%80%99s%20%E2%80%98land-linked%E2%80%99%20economies%20poised%20to%20drive%20continent%E2%80%99s%20prosperity&url=https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165614 "Share this via Twitter (opens in a new window)")

By leveraging their central location, expanding regional connectivity and embracing transformative technologies, Africa’s landlocked developing countries (LLDCs) are positioning themselves as vital contributors to the continent’s prosperity and sustainable development.

[![Image 11: Indigenous Peoples, like this girl from the K'iche' community in Guatemala, contribute their knowledge to combat climate change.](https://global.unitednations.entermediadb.net/assets/mediadb/services/module/asset/downloads/preset/Collections/Embargoed/10-07-2025_UNICEF_Guatemala-01.jpg/image350x235cropped.jpg)](https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165613)

 © UNICEF/Anderson Flores 

[Indigenous Peoples Day highlights AI’s risks and opportunities](https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165613)
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

8 August 2025

[Human Rights](https://news.un.org/en/news/topic/human-rights)

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165613 "Share this via Facebook (opens in a new window)")[Twitter](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Indigenous%20Peoples%20Day%20highlights%20AI%E2%80%99s%20risks%20and%20opportunities%20&url=https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165613 "Share this via Twitter (opens in a new window)")

In honour of the [International Day](https://www.un.org/en/observances/indigenous-day) of the World’s Indigenous Peoples on 9 August, the UN hosted a virtual commemoration on Friday on the theme [AI: Defending Rights, Shaping Futures](https://social.desa.un.org/issues/indigenous-peoples/events/IDWIP-2025).

[![Image 12: Malnutrition rates have been steadily increasing since March 2025, with hunger growing in Gaza City.](https://global.unitednations.entermediadb.net/assets/mediadb/services/module/asset/downloads/preset/Collections/Embargoed/24-07-2025-UNICEF-Gaza-09.jpg/image350x235cropped.jpg)](https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165612)

 © UNICEF/Mohammed Nateel 

[Israel’s military takeover of Gaza City would mark ‘a dangerous escalation’: Guterres](https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165612)
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

8 August 2025

[Peace and Security](https://news.un.org/en/news/topic/peace-and-security)

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165612 "Share this via Facebook (opens in a new window)")[Twitter](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Israel%E2%80%99s%20military%20takeover%20of%20Gaza%20City%20would%20mark%20%E2%80%98a%20dangerous%20escalation%E2%80%99:%20Guterres%20&url=https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165612 "Share this via Twitter (opens in a new window)")

UN Secretary-General António Guterres has expressed grave concern over Israel’s decision to “take control of Gaza City”, his Spokesperson said in a statement on Friday.

[![Image 13: Nagasaki Peace Statue in Nagasaki Peace Park, Japan.](https://global.unitednations.entermediadb.net/assets/mediadb/services/module/asset/downloads/preset/Libraries/Production%20Library/08-08-2023_nagasaki.jpg/image350x235cropped.jpg)](https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165611)

 UN News/Pengfei Mi 

[‘Nuclear weapons have no place in our world,’ UN chief tells mayors in Nagasaki](https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165611)
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

8 August 2025

[Peace and Security](https://news.un.org/en/news/topic/peace-and-security)

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165611 "Share this via Facebook (opens in a new window)")[Twitter](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=%E2%80%98Nuclear%20weapons%20have%20no%20place%20in%20our%20world,%E2%80%99%20UN%20chief%20tells%20mayors%20in%20Nagasaki%20&url=https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/08/1165611 "Share this via Twitter (opens in a new window)")

80 years after the United States dropped two atomic bombs on the Japanese cities of Hiroshima and Nagasaki, the “only guarantee” against the use of nuclear weapons today is their “total elimination”, the UN Secretary-General [said](https://www.un.org/sg/en/content/sg/statement/2025-08-08/secretary-generals-video-message-the-11th-general-conference-of-mayors-for-peace) on Friday.
